title: Getting started
text: illustration uses openly accessible data Basic Education Evaluation System (Saeb) conducted Brazil’s National Institute Educational Studies Research (Inep), available https://www.gov.br/inep/pt-br/areas-de-atuacao/avaliacao-e-exames-educacionais/saeb/resultados. also available saeb dataset ivd package. Separate within- -school effects. , besides student_ses, compute school_ses. Illustration school level variability:
code: ## Grand mean center student SES #saeb$student_ses <- c(scale(saeb$student_ses, scale = FALSE))  ## Calculate school-level SES school_ses <- saeb[, .(school_ses = mean(student_ses, na.rm = TRUE)), by = school_id]  ## Join the school_ses back to the original dataset saeb <- saeb[school_ses, on = "school_id"]  ## Define student level SES as deviation from the school SES saeb$student_ses <- saeb$student_ses - saeb$school_ses  ## Grand mean center school ses saeb$school_ses <- c(scale(saeb$school_ses, scale = FALSE)) library(ggplot2) plot0 <- ggplot( data = saeb, aes( x = school_id, y = math_proficiency) ) plot0 + geom_point(aes(color =  school_id), show.legend =  FALSE)

title: Getting started
text: predict math_proficiency standardized variable capturing math proficiency end grade 12. , location (means) scale (residual variances) modeled function student school SES. Note formula objects location scale follow lme4 notation. summary shows fixed random effects returns posterior inclusion probabilities (PIP) one 160 schools’ residual variance random effects. PIP returns probability school belonging slab, , probability model include random scale effect. words, large PIP’s indicate schools substantially deviating fixed scale effects either much much less variable compared schools math proficiency. One can readily convert PIP’s odds, indicating school PIP = .75 three times likely belonging slab belonging spike. .50 inclusion prior, odds can readily interpreted Bayes Factors.

what: Diagnostic plots based on coda plots:
title: Getting started
Individual Variance Detection
text: ivd implements Spike--Slab Mixed-Effects Location Scale Model (SS-MELSM, Carmo et al. 2024) detect heterogeneous residual variances hierarchical data. standard mixed-effects models assume constant within-group variability, mixed-effects location scale models explicitly models residual variance function covariates random effects. MELSM approach covariance matrix (thus correlation matrix) random effects across location scale estimated jointly within likelihood. SS-MELSM uses spike--slab prior probabilistically identify specific units (e.g., schools, individuals) exhibit unusually high low consistency, distinguishing population average.

title: Build and compile NIMBLE model and MCMC once This function is exported for use in 'future' and is not meant to be called by user. — build_ivd_model
text: named list two elements: cmodel: compiled NIMBLE model object produced compileNimble(). cmcmc: compiled NIMBLE MCMC object, created using buildMCMC() compileNimble(), configured monitor model parameters (including WAIC monitors useWAIC = TRUE). function intended internal use (e.g., within parallel workers) meant called directly end users.

Defaults NULL (plots parameters). type Coda plot. Defaults 'traceplot'. See coda options 'acfplot', 'densplot' etc. askNewPage user prompted next plot. Defaults TRUE

what: Main function to set up and run parallel MCMC using nimble and future. ivd computes a mixed effects location and scale model with Spike and Slab regularization on the scale random effects. — ivd

text: Main function set run parallel MCMC using nimble future. ivd computes mixed effects location scale model Spike Slab regularization scale random effects.

title: Main function to set up and run parallel MCMC using nimble and future. ivd computes a mixed effects location and scale model with Spike and Slab regularization on the scale random effects. — ivd
code: ivd(   location_formula,   scale_formula,   data,   niter,   nburnin = NULL,   WAIC = TRUE,   workers = 4,   n_eff = "local",   ss_prior_p = 0.5,   ... )

title: Main function to set up and run parallel MCMC using nimble and future. ivd computes a mixed effects location and scale model with Spike and Slab regularization on the scale random effects. — ivd
text: location_formula formula location model scale_formula formula scale model data Data frame long format analysis niter Total number MCMC iterations burnin nburnin Number burnin iterations, defaults niter WAIC Compute WAIC, defaults 'TRUE' workers Number parallel R processes – doubles 'chains' argument n_eff Use stan::monitor function built local: 'stan' vs. 'local' ss_prior_p Prior inclusion probability. Defaults '.5'. ... Currently used

title: Main function to set up and run parallel MCMC using nimble and future. ivd computes a mixed effects location and scale model with Spike and Slab regularization on the scale random effects. — ivd
text: object class "ivd" ("list"), contains results fitting mixed-effects location-scale model Spike--Slab regularization using NIMBLE parallel MCMC sampling. returned object named list following components: samples: mcmc.list object containing posterior samples monitored parameters across chains. logLik_array: 3D array pointwise log-likelihood values dimensions iterations × chains × N. rhat_values: Vector split-\(\hat{R}\) convergence diagnostics (Vehtari et al., 2021). n_eff: Vector effective sample sizes, either computed internally ("local") via rstan::monitor() ("stan"). nimble_constants: List model constants used underlying NIMBLE model (e.g., number groups, number parameters). X_location_names, Z_location_names: Names fixed random effects location submodel. X_scale, Z_scale: Matrices used scale submodel’s fixed random effects. Y: Data frame response vector group identifiers. workers: Number parallel chains used. ...: Additional elements created internally used downstream S3 methods (print(), summary(), etc.). object designed support S3 methods printing, summarizing, extracting results ivd model.

title: Main function to set up and run parallel MCMC using nimble and future. ivd computes a mixed effects location and scale model with Spike and Slab regularization on the scale random effects. — ivd
code: # \donttest{ out <- ivd(location_formula = math_proficiency ~ 1 + (1 | school_id),    scale_formula =  ~ 1 + (1 | school_id),    data = saeb,    niter = 1000,    nburnin = 2000,    WAIC = TRUE,    workers = 1) ## Workers = 1 for CRAN server - not ideal for individual use #> nimble version 1.3.0 is loaded. #> For more information on NIMBLE and a User Manual, #> please visit https://R-nimble.org. #>  #> Note for advanced users who have written their own MCMC samplers: #>   As of version 0.13.0, NIMBLE's protocol for handling posterior #>   predictive nodes has changed in a way that could affect user-defined #>   samplers in some situations. Please see Section 15.5.1 of the User Manual. #> ===== Monitors ===== #> thin = 1: Ustar, beta, sigma_rand, ss, z, zeta #> ===== Samplers ===== #> conjugate sampler (1) #>   - beta[]  (1 element) #> binary sampler (320) #>   - ss[]  (320 elements) #> RW_lkj_corr_cholesky sampler (1) #>   - Ustar[1:2, 1:2]  #> RW sampler (323) #>   - z[]  (320 elements) #>   - zeta[]  (1 element) #>   - sigma_rand[]  (2 elements) #> thin = 1: R, beta, mu, sigma_rand, ss, tau, u, zeta #> |-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------| #> |-------------------------------------------------------| #>   [Warning] There are 7 individual pWAIC values that are greater than 0.4. This may indicate that the WAIC estimate is unstable (Vehtari et al., 2017), at least in cases without grouping of data nodes or multivariate data nodes. #> Defining model #> Building model #> Setting data and initial values #>   [Note] 'X' is provided in 'data' but is not a variable in the model and is being ignored. #>   [Note] 'X_scale' is provided in 'data' but is not a variable in the model and is being ignored. #>   [Note] 'Z_scale' is provided in 'data' but is not a variable in the model and is being ignored. #> Running calculate on model #>   [Note] Any error reports that follow may simply reflect missing values in model variables. #> Checking model sizes and dimensions #>   [Note] This model is not fully initialized. This is not an error. #>          To see which variables are not initialized, use model$initializeInfo(). #>          For more information on model initialization, see help(modelInitialization). #> Compiling #>   [Note] This may take a minute. #>   [Note] Use 'showCompilerOutput = TRUE' to see C++ compilation details. #> Compiling #>   [Note] This may take a minute. #>   [Note] Use 'showCompilerOutput = TRUE' to see C++ compilation details. #>   [Note] 'X' is provided in 'data' but is not a variable in the model and is being ignored. #>   [Note] 'X_scale' is provided in 'data' but is not a variable in the model and is being ignored. #>   [Note] 'Z_scale' is provided in 'data' but is not a variable in the model and is being ignored. #> running chain 1... #> Warning: Some R-hat values are greater than 1.10 -- increase warmup and/or sampling iterations. ## Posterior inclusion probability plot (PIP) plot(out, type = "pip")  ## PIP vs. Within-cluster SD plot(out, type =  "funnel")  ## Diagnostic plots based on coda plots: library(coda) codaplot(out, parameters =  "Intc")  codaplot(out, parameters =  "R[scl_Intc, Intc]")  # }

what: Plot method for ivd objects — plot.ivd
title: Plot method for ivd objects — plot.ivd
Plot method for ivd objects — plot.ivd
code: # S3 method for class 'ivd' plot(   x,   type = "pip",   pip_level = 0.75,   variable = NULL,   label_points = TRUE,   ... )

title: Plot method for ivd objects — plot.ivd
text: x object type ivd. type Defaults 'pip', options 'funnel' 'outcome'. pip_level Defines value posterior inclusion probability. Defaults 0.75. variable Name specific variable. Defaults NULL label_points points pip threshold labelled? Defaults TRUE. ... Controls ggrepel aruments.

title: Plot method for ivd objects — plot.ivd
text: Invisibly returns ggplot object corresponding selected plot type. primary purpose method side effect displaying plot. exact plot depends value type: "pip" — Posterior inclusion probability plot random scale effects. "funnel" — Funnel plot showing relation within-cluster standard deviation (tau) posterior inclusion probabilities. "outcome" — Outcome plot relating cluster means (mu), posterior inclusion probability, within-cluster SD. label_points = TRUE, labels clusters exceeding pip_level threshold added using ggrepel (available).

title: Plot method for ivd objects — plot.ivd

title: Run MCMC on an already compiled model Exposed but internal function for future() — run_MCMC_compiled_model
text: output produced nimble::runMCMC() applied compiled NIMBLE MCMC object.  returned value depends useWAIC argument: useWAIC = TRUE, named list containing: samples: matrix posterior draws (iterations × parameters). WAIC: WAIC value computed NIMBLE. ...: Additional elements returned runMCMC() WAIC enabled. useWAIC = FALSE, numeric matrix containing posterior samples (iterations × parameters) additional elements. function intended internal use (e.g., within future workers) meant called directly end users.

title: Basic Education Evaluation System (Saeb) -2021 — saeb
text: Basic Education Evaluation System (Saeb) series large-scale external assessments conducted Inep (National Institute Educational Studies Research) diagnose state basic education Brazil identify factors may affect student performance. dataset contains standardized math scores 12th graders 160 randomly selected schools Rio de Janeiro took 2021 exam.

title: Basic Education Evaluation System (Saeb) -2021 — saeb
text: data frame 11386 student's observations including 5 variables: school_id unique identifier school dataset. public binary variable indicating type school. takes value 1 school public 0 school private. student_ses numerical variable representing socioeconomic status (SES) students. math_proficiency numerical variable representing math proficiency level students, standardized mean 0 standard deviation 1. location numerical variable indicating geographical location school. takes value 1 urban schools 2 rural schools.

text: object ivd object digits Integer (Default: 2, optional). Number digits round printing. pip Print pip model parameters (''); pip ('pip'), model parameeters 9('model'). Defaults '' ... used
